title: The Circle’s Emma Willis mistakes show for Big Brother in hilarious slip-up
text:
Emma Willis had a little mishap on The Circle final (Picture: Channel 4)

Emma Willis suffered a comical mishap during The Circle final, where she slipped back into her Big Brother presenting habits.

The 43-year-old presenter kicked off the show’s climactic final by speaking to Ella, who became the last player to be blocked ahead of the conclusion.

As Ella was brought out and met many of the past contestants for the first time, Emma decided to give her an update on everything from the outside world.

‘Let’s get you up to speed,’ Emma said. ‘When you first entered the house…’

Realising her mistake referring to Big Brother, Emma corrected: ‘Not the house, the apartments.’

The small error was quickly picked up by the studio audience and Ella herself, who was left laughing hysterically.

Advertisement

Advertisement

In response, Emma said: ‘Oh, come on!’

Viewers quite enjoyed the accidental Big Brother throwback too.

#TheCircle 'what's it feel like coming out of the house?' whoops #emmawillis wrong show!! — maggie white (@maggiethemoog) October 18, 2019

Emma presented Big Brother and Celebrity Big Brother from 2013 to 2018, replacing Brian Dowling who hosted the show after its move to Channel 5.

You can catch The Circle on Channel 4 on demand.

MORE: The Circle recap: Sammie and Tim clash as Jan becomes victim of ‘The Revolution’
description: Emma Willis had a Big Brother mishap on The Circle final.
